Title: DSM Web API
Description: The "DSM Web API" project provides portable libraries to call the APIs exposed by a Synology's NAS running the DSM system.
HomeWiki:
Project Description
The "DSM Web API" project provides portable libraries to call the APIs exposed by a Synology's NAS running the DSM system.

The DSM

The DSM (Disk System Manager) is the operating system running on Synology's NAS. It provides many features and can be extended through the installation of packages.

Supported APIs

Disclaimer
Since I have only one NAS to test on and that nothing is downgradeable on the DSM (including the DSM itself), this project supports only the latest version of the DSM and its packages.

Available :
  • Core
    • Authentication
      • Log on with a password (No 2-step verification yet)
      • Log off
    • API Information (Lists the APIs available and their supported versions)
    • Encryption
  • DSM
    • Applications (list)
    • AutoBlock (list blocked addresses, read and write the configuration)
    • Connections (list)
    • Encrypt Share (mount and unmount encrypted shares)
    • Find Me (Start and stop the Find Me beep)
    • Groups (list)
    • Information (Model, Memory installed, Serial, Temperature, Time, Uptime, DSM Version)
    • Log Viewer (list)
    • Network (list network interfaces configuration)
    • Packages (list)
    • Services (list)
    • Shares (list)
    • System (Ping, Shutdown or Reboot the system)
    • System Loading (CPU load, Memory load and Network load)
    • Users (list)
    • Volumes (list)

Coming next :

Getting started

  • Add one or more of the following NuGet packages :
    • DsmWebApi.Core
    • DsmWebApi.Dsm
  • Use the APIs as in the following example :
private async Task UseDsmWebApi()
{
    // Load the API context
    IDsmApiContext apiContext = new DsmWebApiContext(new Uri("http://192.168.0.9:5000/webapi/"));
    await apiContext.LoadAllApiInfo();

    // Authenticate
    AuthenticationApi authenticationApi = new AuthenticationApi(apiContext);
    await authenticationApi.LogOn("admin", "password");

    // Use the API. In this example, retrieve the list of all users on the DSM.
    DsmUserApi dsmUserApi = new DsmUserApi(apiContext);
    var allUsers = await dsmUserApi.List(null, null);

    // Log off
    await authenticationApi.LogOff();
}
